answers.author: Robert Cole
answers.text:
Hi, Kristin.
It seems that the citizen survey results accompanied by staff analysis should generally be sufficiently supportive of a council goal-setting sessions without the necessity of a council survey also being conducted. Rather than a council survey, employee surveys may return a greater return on investment if executed properly, including appropriate follow-up.
As you may know, surveys are great for gleaning insights and opinions from large groups of people and/or those that might be reluctant to discuss thoughts or opinions amidst their peers and colleagues, particularly where concerns about threats to employment might be perceived, e.g., employee surveys. That written, it doesn't seem that city councils generally fit either category as their opionions and concerns may be best addressed directly in one-on-one, where appropriate, and group discussions.
Castle Rock is a great place, but I guess you know that. :)

answers.author: Barry Crook
answers.text:
We have surveyed our Council in the past . . . here's the one from 2007. It is part of our Goals & Outcome Measures effort and this survey gets feedback from Council on the work of the departments that support their work.  
In all honesty, it is difficult to get them to respond to the survey requests . . . I get more out of a part of our planning retreat where we ask them to brainstorm their successes and disappointments during the past year, and how the city staff has contributed to either.

answers.text:
I might add, the Leadership Team goes through the same exercise prior to the Council retreat and will share our list with them when we see it as helpful to getting them to dive into the conversation without filtering their comments (isn't usually a problem). We want them to know it is OK to be honest in their evaluations and that we won't take it personally if they criticize us -- if you are going to make improvements you have to first be honest about the current state and how it compares to the desired state.

author: Kristin Zagurski
text:
The Town of Castle Rock is planning a citizen survey this year. As a companion to that process, we're also interested in conducting a Council survey -- likely by asking for feedback on a range of issues on a Likert scale. Data collected via both surveys would be used for strategic planning purposes.
We're wondering if anyone has conducted a similar survey for their council/other elected board and, if so, if you'd please share your information. Thanks!
title: Council survey?
